alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 5:56PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cherokee County through 630 PM CDT... At 556 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Payne, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cedar Bluff, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Sand Rock, Gaylesville, Cornwall Furnace Park, Blanche, Little River Falls, Eastern Weiss Lake, Western Weiss Lake, Fullerton, New Moon, Broomtown, Chesterfield and Little River Canyon NP. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northeastern Alabama.
